publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-157 Patricia Ferguson: Critics Awards for Theatre in Scotland—That the Parliament notes the recent presentation of the Critics Awards for Theatre in Scotland; congratulates all those artists and theatre groups who won awards, and particularly recognises the achievement of the National Theatre of Scotland in winning four out of 10 awards presented for its much acclaimed production, "Black Watch".

S3M-157 Critics Awards for Theatre in Scotland (lodged on 12 June 2007) Kenneth Gibson*, Bill Butler*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Mary Mulligan*, Mr Frank McAveety*, David Whitton*, Ken Macintosh*, Trish Godman*, Alasdair Allan*, John Lamont*, Robin Harper*, Claire Baker*, Jackie Baillie*, Marlyn Glen*, Elaine Murray*, Karen Gillon*, Karen Whitefield*
S3M-157 Critics Awards for Theatre in Scotland (lodged on 12 June 2007) Cathie Craigie*, Marilyn Livingstone*

S3M-157 Patricia Ferguson: Critics Awards for Theatre in Scotland—That the Parliament notes the recent presentation of the Critics Awards for Theatre in Scotland; congratulates all those artists and theatre groups who won awards, and particularly recognises the achievement of the National Theatre of Scotland in winning four out of 10 awards presented for its much acclaimed production, "Black Watch". Supported by: Kenneth Gibson, Bill Butler, Hugh O’Donnell, Mary Mulligan, Mr Frank McAveety, David Whitton, Ken Macintosh, Trish Godman, Alasdair Allan, John Lamont, Robin Harper, Claire Baker, Jackie Baillie, Marlyn Glen, Elaine Murray, Karen Gillon, Karen Whitefield, Cathie Craigie, Marilyn Livingstone
S3M-157 Critics Awards for Theatre in Scotland (lodged on 12 June 2007) Bob Doris*
S3M-157 Critics Awards for Theatre in Scotland (lodged on 12 June 2007) Sandra White*
S3M-157 Critics Awards for Theatre in Scotland (lodged on 12 June 2007) Jack McConnell*
S3M-157 Critics Awards for Theatre in Scotland (lodged on 12 June 2007) Mr Jamie Stone*
S3M-157 Critics Awards for Theatre in Scotland (lodged on 12 June 2007) Cathy Peattie*
